issue.title: Design: Adjust colors in email messages in dark mode
issue.body:
### Describe the bug

When we use dark mode, messages received in the email channel are affected by the white background and lack of contrast in the content.

![image](https://github.com/chatwoot/chatwoot/assets/34479816/6c2b2cf6-4ceb-4262-848d-c5bdda620e1d)


### To Reproduce

1. Activate an email inbox
2. Send a new message to account
3. Open message

### Expected behavior

![image](https://github.com/chatwoot/chatwoot/assets/34479816/f6a261f0-1085-4e8c-944a-02b114f5261f)


### Environment

Linux VM

### Cloud Provider

None

### Platform

None

### Operating system

_No response_

### Browser and version

_No response_

### Docker (if applicable)

_No response_

### Additional context

_No response_

issue.title: feat: implement redis database number
issue.body:
# Pull Request Template

## Description

This PR adds configurable Redis database number.

## Type of change

- [x] New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)

## How Has This Been Tested?

Build and start app in docker with custom `REDIS_DB_NUM` value - works correctly.

## Checklist:

- [x] My code follows the style guidelines of this project
- [ ] I have performed a self-review of my code
- [ ] I have commented on my code, particularly in hard-to-understand areas
- [ ] I have made corresponding changes to the documentation
- [ ] My changes generate no new warnings
- [ ] I have added tests that prove my fix is effective or that my feature works
- [ ] New and existing unit tests pass locally with my changes
- [ ] Any dependent changes have been merged and published in downstream modules

pull_request.title: feat: implement redis database number
pull_request.body:
# Pull Request Template

## Description

This PR adds configurable Redis database number.

## Type of change

- [ ] New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)

## How Has This Been Tested?

Build and start app in docker with custom `REDIS_DB_NUM` value - works correctly.

## Checklist:

- [ ] My code follows the style guidelines of this project
- [ ] I have performed a self-review of my code
- [ ] I have commented on my code, particularly in hard-to-understand areas
- [ ] I have made corresponding changes to the documentation
- [ ] My changes generate no new warnings
- [ ] I have added tests that prove my fix is effective or that my feature works

pull_request.title: feat: Update public portal colors
pull_request.body:
# Pull Request Template

## Description

Please include a summary of the change and issue(s) fixed. Also, mention relevant motivation, context, and any dependencies that this change requires.
Fixes # (issue)

## Type of change

Please delete options that are not relevant.

- [ ] Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [ ] New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
- [ ] Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality not to work as expected)
- [ ] This change requires a documentation update

## How Has This Been Tested?

Please describe the tests that you ran to verify your changes. Provide instructions so we can reproduce. Please also list any relevant details for your test configuration.


## Checklist:

- [ ] My code follows the style guidelines of this project
- [ ] I have performed a self-review of my code
- [ ] I have commented on my code, particularly in hard-to-understand areas
- [ ] I have made corresponding changes to the documentation
- [ ] My changes generate no new warnings
- [ ] I have added tests that prove my fix is effective or that my feature works
- [ ] New and existing unit tests pass locally with my changes
- [ ] Any dependent changes have been merged and published in downstream modules

issue.title: feat: update tool-chain to latest
issue.body:
This PR updates the following packages

1. Jest
2. Babel
3. Prettier
4. ESlint

### Checklist

- [x] `yarn`
- [x] `yarn test:coverage`
- [x] `bundle exec rake assets:precompile`
- [x] `yarn eslint`
- [x] `yarn build-storybook -o ./app/javascript/storybook-build`
